site_number: Modebest Plant Ltd & Old Rectory Nirsery
description: Erection of a single storey office building (650sqm) refurbishment and retention of brick building to north of site (129sqm) with car parking, landscaping and general site layout improvement works, including landscaping and car parking layout changes in the grounds of the Old Rectory.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Location plan, Elevations (existing) 1of2, Elevations (existing) 2of2, 306/100 (Proposed plans and section) 306/001 (Site plan), 306/102 (Existing sections), 306/102 (Proposed plans), 306/103 (Proposed roof plan and sections) 306/104 (Proposed elevations), 306/105 (Existing security lodge elevations), 306/106 (Proposed security lodge elevations), 306/110 (Isometric and materials), 306/150 (Entrance gate details), 306/151 (Storage yard barrier details), 590.10.03 (Landscape layout), 590.11.03 (Landscape Sections/elevations), Planning Statement, Design and Access Statement, Heritage Statement, Sustainability Statement, PlatoWood specification, Polycarbonate details, Sedum Roof technical data sheet received on 18/07/2013
121004-TK01 Rev B and 121004-TK02 Rev B (Swept patterns and proposed storage stack areas) received on 09/10/2013
Transport Assessment received 14/10/2013) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 4 - A landscape management plan and planting schedule with plant species, sizes and densities shall be submitted to and approved by the lcoal planning authority prior to commencement of the development. The landscape plan as approved (drawing 590.10.03) and planting schedule as approved shall be carried out prior to first occupation of the proposed office building.

Condition : 5 - Before the development commences details of disabled parking and the layout of all proposed parking shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the spaces shown on the approved drawing shall be available for use before first occupation of any part of the development.

Condition : 6 - All boundary treatment works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  The works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed with the local planning authority

Condition : 7 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on the approved drawing within the grounds of The Rectory shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials at the Old Rectory storage yard have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 9 - Details of any floodlighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the any of the buildings are occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 10 - Three months prior to commencement of works on site the applicant shall pay for the implementation of yellow lines to the front of the property and costs associated with the preparation of the Traffic Management Order as requried by the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984.

Condition : 11 - No development shall take place, until the applicant, or their agents or successors in title, has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme of investigation, including the timetable for the investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 12 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 13 - No development shall take place until details have been submitted and approved by the local planning authority for a construction management plan and construction logistics plan.

Condition : 14 - The Old Rectory Yard shall be used for as a storage yard and for no other purpose and the office building and security lodge shall be used only as ancillary B1(a) in connection to the use of the site.

Condition : 15 - No permenant or temprorary buildings (including portacabins) and no external plant (including fans, louvres, ducts) shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 16 - The storage area stacks hereby approved shall be used only for storage of equipment and materials and shall not exceed 5m in height.

Condition : 17 - No staff shall be on site, no machinery shall be operated, no process shall be carried out and no deliveries taken at or despatched from the Old Rectory Yard site outside the following times 7am to 8pm Monday-Friday and 7am to 2pm Saturday nor at any time on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.
